author: sky.cactus
content: <@488328812501663744> Please post whatever you learn here.  I'm very curious if witness encryption is actually possible.  Combining it with blockchain state transition functions, it opens a number of doors for some fancy stuff one could build on top of it.

author: sky.cactus
content: A simple example is that it simplifies commit-reveal schemes *greatly* from a UX standpoint.

author: sky.cactus
content: Rather than needing to first commit, then wait, then reveal you can instead commit a witness encrypted thing and then have it be revealed by bots after the triggering event occurs.

author: sky.cactus
content: My suspicion is that going from "it is theoretically possible to turn any function into a witness function" to "actually turning a full Ethereum client into a witness function" is a pretty huge leap though.
